description: The potent ice magic of this cold, covetous creature is outmatched only by its insatiable greed. It scours the lower depths of the Ice Lairs in search of all manner of brisk bounty to add to its limitless frozen hoard.

name: Belchazar Banewright
description: This repugnant reprobate has a reputation for being rude, crude, and having a reprehensibly crass sense of humour. His deep, bellowing laughter can frequently be heard echoing throughout the Toxic Tunnels and wherever that iconic sound is heard, his signature stench is sure to follow. Despite being utterly repulsive to most creatures, the other Poison Dragons find him to be an absolute blast at their sickening soirees.

name: Blizzara Winterosa
description: This young but talented mouse is a prodigy in the ways of draconic magic. She may be tasked with guard duty for now but one day, she'll be slinging spells and hoarding treasure with the most powerful Ice Dragons in the Depths!

name: Chillandria Permafrost
description: This cool conjurer is one of the most esteemed ice mages ever to glide through the Ice Lairs. Her ability to manipulate snow, sleet, and hail is so devastatingly powerful that some Ice Dragons believe she may actually be the original creator of the winter season.

name: Colonel Crisp
description: This brazen blazer leads the charge at defending the Flame Caverns with boisterous, burning bravery. His speeches are inspiring, his courage is infectious, and his fashion sense is so hot right now.

name: Combustius Furnaceheart
description: This steaming sentry of the Flame Caverns is known for the inextinguishable, fiery rage that burns deep inside it. Even the other Fire Dragons know to keep their distance whenever this blazing beast gets hot under the collar.

name: Corrupticus the Blight Baron
description: This malicious, malignant monster commands the legions of Poison Dragons and rules over the wretched wastes of the Toxic Tunnels. Its tainted throne lies in the deepest, most dangerous regions of that putrid place where it waits to corrupt only the bravest and most foolish intruders that dare to delve so deep. It is said that few ever manage to escape from an encounter with this sinister scourge but those who do are forever sullied by its stalwart stench. It has recently been observed that the stinking, sickening saliva secreted by this snide, spiteful serpent is uncannily similar in both odour and chemical composition to the horrid sludge that pervades the Toxic Spill.

name: Dreck Grimehaven
description: When it comes to getting your hands dirty, Dreck Grimehaven is the utmost expert! His job is to seed the entrance to the Toxic Tunnels with extremely volatile, bioluminescent, super slime. Few realize that the defensive qualities of this process are actually just a convenient side effect. The task's original intended purpose was merely to give the tunnels a more festive glow to help combat their rather dismal reputation.

name: Flamina Cinderbreath
description: Many Fire Dragons look towards this wise, elderly dragon as something of an oracle; a beacon of light to guide their way through the dim depths of the Flame Caverns.

name: Frigidocius Coldshot
description: With icicle-sharp focus, this chilly combatant lies in wait to intercept any intruder foolish enough to wander into the Ice Lairs. They're especially known for their keen eyes, everlasting patience, and utter disdain for any creature with a discernible body temperature.

name: Frostnip Icebound
description: This small, frigid fellow has been tasked with defending the Ice Lairs but is maybe not really the best mouse for the job. He is trying his best but is constantly getting distracted by all the pretty icicles everywhere and has a tendency to not be around when he's needed.

name: Goopus Dredgemore
description: Many of the jobs required for defending the Toxic Tunnels would seem grotesque and unbearable to most mice but for the Poison Dragons, they're considered a treat! This mouse has a particular affinity for dredging up the slimy goop that gives the Toxic Tunnels their unique aroma.

name: Iciclesius the Defender
description: This frosty frontliner has been tasked with defending the entrance to the Ice Lairs in the Draconic Depths and judging by the battle scars lining that ice shield, it takes its job very seriously!

name: Incendarius the Unquenchable
description: The flaming fury of this fiery fiend seems to be fuelled by just about anything it can get its fangs on. Its avaricious appetite forces it to remain in the lower depths of the Flame Caverns where the heaviest and heartiest treasures can be found, hoarded, and eventually consumed.

name: Magnatius Majestica
description: This clever and covetous creature has an unbridled obsession with seizing control over all the power and wealth that the many elements have to offer. It slithers and flutters throughout the Elemental Dragons' Den counting, collecting, and claiming every inch as its own personal domain to be protected at all costs.

name: Mythical Dragon Emperor
description:
After losing his tenure at the School of Sorcery, the relentless and resourceful Mythweaver came to realize that fantasy alone would not be enough to finally defeat the pesky humans and their persistent MouseHunters. He realized that he would need something much bigger and more terrifying this time. He needed something that struck to the very core of human fear, that burrowed deep into the psyche of MouseHunters and awakened some primal terror that has remained dormant since the time of their most ancient ancestors. He needed something so great and terrible that it would instantly remind the humans of their lowly place in the hierarchy of species.

After much searching, he eventually discovered a book much older and more primitive than the folktales he had been rewriting thus far. This book described a very different world with very different masters from a time long before the age of humans. A time that was ruled by fear and ferociousness, where only the mightiest and most ruthless survived and thrived; a time when mercy, compassion, and civilization were concepts yet to be discovered. T'was the time of dragons!

The Mythweaver studied the Tale of the First Dragons extensively and learned a most shocking and fortuitous discovery: the age of dragons had not ended, it was merely awaiting the beginning of its next chapter! And so, with quill in hand, inhibitions unfettered, and delusions of grandeur abound, he set upon that most villainous deed of penning the next chapter himself.

He followed the directions spelled out in the book and it led him deep below the Folklore Forest to a place that time forgot: the Draconic Depths. Deep within these coarse, cacophonous caverns, the Mythweaver discovered the hidden home and true origin of all the dragons in Gnawnia. Every great dragon that he had studied from the world above could trace its origins back to these dark and dangerous depths. From the furious flames of Kalor'ignis to the frigid ferocity of Icewing and all the way back to the great Dragon mouse itself. All of these legendary beasts once called these depths their home.

Here the Mythweaver had everything he needed to amass the greatest and most terrible army of ancient monsters with which to lay waste to the human world above. So he used every ounce of his fabled magic to transform himself into the mightiest dragon of them all and named himself their Emperor. Now he intends to lead this legendary legion up to the surface and dispose of the human Kingdom of Gnawnia once and for all. That is, unless the strongest and bravest MouseHunters can face their fears and descend into these dreadful depths to put a stop to this heinous plan before it takes flight!

name: Noxio Sludgewell
description: This burly bruiser was assigned to sludge transportation duty on the front line because his superiors believed that his large, intimidating physique would be a great asset for defending the Toxic Tunnels. Little did they know that this mouse is actually a tenderhearted try-hard who just wants everyone to like him which is why he makes such an effort to dress up for work every day.

name: Pestilentia the Putrid
description: Even amongst the Poison Dragons, this bloated, blistered monstrosity is considered a vile and disgusting specimen. She is as rapacious as she is revolting as she seeks to hoard anything of value that makes its way into the buried bowels of the Toxic Tunnels. Her wariness of intruders makes her elusive and reclusive as she guards the tainted treasures that she has stowed away in those dark and dismal depths.

name: Squire Sizzleton
description: This short, sizzling squire may not be big or strong or smart or experienced but he has ambition and a can-do attitude so the larger Fire Dragons sent him up to the front lines to test his mettle.

name: Sulfurious the Raging Inferno
description: This smouldering, gargantuan horror dwells in the deepest regions of the Flame Caverns where the heat is so intense that the air tastes perpetually of ash. From within these fiery depths, this creature rules an infernal legion of Fire Dragons with its violent, explosive temper. Legend has it that all the heat of the Flame Caverns is fuelled by the volcanic, everlasting rage that burns within the heart of this burning behemoth. Like any untended fire, this dragon's inextinguishable fury has been known to spread and it is now theorized that it may also be the origin of other fiery eruptions throughout Gnawnia.

name: Supremia Magnificus
description: This vain, exceptionally arrogant creature looks down upon all other dragons, including its fellow Elemental Dragons. It views itself as the absolute pinnacle of its species and deems all other creatures as unworthy of its magnificent presence. However, the disdain that it feels towards the other dragons pales in comparison to the ruthless loathing that it exudes for anything non-draconic, most especially humans. Any human who dares to delve into the Elemental Dragons' Den had best prepare themselves for this dragon's intolerant fury!

name: Three'amat the Mother of Dragons
description:
From time immemorial, this monstrous matriarch has ruled over her draconic descendants from the dangerous depths of the Elemental Dragons' Den. Legend has it that she is the original dragon from which all other dragons spawned. As for her own origins, no one knows but some say that she was hatched at the dawn of the world, when day first met night, good first met evil, and the elements were still wild and untethered to the sky, land, and sea.

Until recently, she was the commander that sent forth her malevolent minions unto the world but now that the Mythweaver has inserted himself at the head of the draconic hierarchy, her power and influence has waned. She has since been spending her time accumulating wealth and growing her impressive hoard of loot.

name: Torchbearer Tinderhelm
description: One of the noblest, most prestigious roles for a Fire Dragon is that of the Torchbearer who is tasked with holding the sacred Fire Axe, unwaveringly, at the entrance to the Flame Caverns. While it is certainly a prestigious position, it is not exactly the most coveted one because it involves a lot of standing around on the surface instead of nestling up in the warm and cozy caverns below.

name: Tranquilia Protecticus
description: This serene and stalwart protector is the only Elemental Dragon that lives exclusively on the surface. She has selflessly made it her mission to guard and maintain the delicate balance between the elements on the uncivilized surface world. She is so focussed and steadfast that the only thing that can distract her from her duties is a little taste of home.

name: Venomona Festerbloom
description: This beastly brute glides through the Toxic Tunnels with surprising poise and grace. Her bright yellow wings reflect the sickening natural glow of the tunnels onto her slimy, viscous skin causing her muscles to shimmer and glisten as she flits around like a revolting, floating night light.
